oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fire Prevention Week Cards at Fort Negley Laundry, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1955, Vol. 3 p. 138
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of an unidentified man at Fort Negley Laundry-Cleaners, located at 932 8th Avenue South, attaching Fire Prevention Week cards to dry cleaning. Photographer unknown. Photo used by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1955. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
